src_text: the public service does not belong to any one party, nor should it be the domain of any particular interest group.
tgt_text: tirelopuso ga se ya mokga tlho o o rileng wa dipolotiki, e bile ga e a tshwanelwa go tshe getsa setlhopha se se rileng se e leng sona se se busang.

src_text: it should not be a law unto itself.
tgt_text: tirelopuso ga ya tshwanela go itirela fela jaaka e batla.

src_text: the public service belongs to the people of south africa.
tgt_text: tirelopuso ke ya baagi ba aforika borwa.

src_text: it must serve them and them alone.
tgt_text: tirelopuso e e dirang ka manontlhotlho vukuzenzele unnamed fa ke ne ke tlhophiwa go okama maemo a moporesitente wa aforika borwa, ke solofedi tse gore tse dingwe tsa dilo tse di botlhokwa ke go aga puso e e dirang ka botswa pelo, ka matsetseleko le ka maikarabelo mme e bile gape e sena bonweenwee.

src_text: traditional leaders key to recovery efforts vukuzenzele unnamed in the last few months, we have had to bid a sad farewell to two of our country’s most respected traditional monarchs.
tgt_text: baeteledipele ba merero ya setso ba na le seabe se se botlhokwa mo go tsosoloseng ikonomi ya rona vukuzenzeke unnamed mo dikgweding di le mmalwa tse di fetileng re ne ra tshwanela ke go laelana le dikgosi di le pedi tse di tlotliwang tsa naga ya rona ka di iketse badimong.

src_text: the zulu people recently laid to rest his majesty king goodwill zwelithini ka bhekuzulu who reigned for half a century.
tgt_text: sešweng jaana morafe wa mazulu o sa tswa go fitlha kgosi ya bona motlotlegi goodwill zwelithini ka bhe kuzulu yo a nang le sebaka sa dingwaga di le masome tlhano a busa.

src_text: in january, the bapedi people buried kgoshikgolo thulare thulare iii, who passed away less than a year after his inauguration.
tgt_text: mo kgweding ya ferikgong morafe wa ba pedi o fitlhile kgosi ya bona e bong kgoshikgolo thulare thulare wa boraro, yo a tlho kafetseng a na le sebaka se se sa feteng ngwaga a busa.

src_text: with their passing, we have lost champions of the preservation of our heritage, and revered custodians of the histories of their respective peoples.
tgt_text: maso a bona e tota e le tatlhe gelo ya basomarelangwao, basomarelahisetori ya merafe eo ba neng ba e busa.

src_text: at the same time, they were vital players in rural development, and were committed to driving programmes to uplift the material conditions of their people.
tgt_text: le fa go le jalo, e ne gape e le banna le seabe ba ba botlhokwa thata mo tlhabo lolong ya metseselegae, e bile ba ne ba ikemiseditse go tlisa tlhabologo mo matshelong a merafe ya bona.

src_text: with the advent of democracy in 1994, it was a priority of the new government to restore the integrity and legitimacy of traditional leadership in line with indigenous law and customs and subject to the constitution of the republic.
tgt_text: fa temokerasi e roga ka ngwaga wa 1994, go ne ga totobala gore puso e ntšhwa e e neng e le gona e tsaya ma rapo e tshwanetse go busetse sekeng seriti sa magosi go ya ka melao ya setso sa batho batsho eo e tsamaelanang le molaotheo wa rephaboliki ya aforika borwa.

src_text: the institution of traditional leadership continues to play an important role in the lives of millions of people around our country, especially in rural areas.
tgt_text: setheo sa baeteledipele ba merero ya setso se tswelela go nna le seabe se se botlho kwa mo matshelong a dimili one tsa batho ba naga ya rona, bogolosegolo kwa metsesele gaeng.

src_text: traditional leaders support and drive development in their communities.
tgt_text: magosi a tswelela go tshegetsa le go tlisa tlhabololo mo metseng eo ba e busang.

src_text: recently, i had the opportunity to participate in the debate on the opening of the national house of traditional leaders, which was concerned with the most pressing issues currently facing the country.
tgt_text: mo malobeng ke ne ka nee lwa tšhono ya go tsenela di ngangisano tsa pulo ya ntlo ya bosetšhaba ya dikgosi, moo go samaganweng le dintlha tse di tlhobaetsang tseo naga ya rona e tobaneng le tsona ga jaana.

src_text: what was particularly refreshing about the robust engagement was that traditional leadership has a keen appreciation of the difficult economic conditions facing our country, and want to be part of addressing the many challenges of underdevelopment and poverty in their areas.
tgt_text: se se nthotloeditseng thata ka ga dingangisano tseno tse di neng di runtse ke go tlha loganya ga magosi gore iko nomi ya rona e mo maemong a a tlhobaetsang mme e bile ba batla go nna le seabe mo go rarabololeng dikgwetlho tse dintsi tse di ka ga tlho kego ya tlhabologo le lehuma mo mafelong ao ba a busang.

src_text: i have consistently said that our economic recovery in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic must be inclusive, and that nobody must be left behind.
tgt_text: ga ke a bolo go nna ke ntse ke re dikgato tsa go tsosolosa ikonomi ya rona go tswa mo leroborobong la mogare wa corona di tshwanetse go tswe la botlhe mosola e bile ga go ope yo re tshwanetseng go mo sia kwa morago.

src_text: the success of the economic reconstruction and recovery plan rests on forging strong partnerships between not just government, business and labour, but also with traditional leadership and other societal formations.
tgt_text: go atlega mo go diraga tseng leano la itharabologelo le kagosešwa ya ikonomi go tlhoka gore re nne le tirisa nommogo e e gagametseng e seng fela le puso, dikgwebo le badiri, mme gape le go nna le tirisanommogo le magosi le mekgatlho e mengwe ya baagi.

src_text: a constant refrain from participants in the debate recently was that they do not want to be dependent on handouts or for their communities to perpetually look to government for financial assistance.
tgt_text: maikutlo a mantsi a bao ba neng ba na le seabe mo dinga ngisanong tseno ke gore ga ba batle go itshepela mo go neelweng masaledi kgotsa go bona baagi ba metse ya bona ba iphedisa ka go tlamelwa ke puso ka matlole a go ba thusa.

src_text: they want to be provided with the necessary support, training and enabling environment to allow rural communities to be selfsufficient.
tgt_text: ba batla gore ba emiwe nokeng ka tshegetso e ba e tlhokang, ka go katisiwa le go tlholelwa tikologo e e bulelang batho dikgoro go kgontsha baagi ba kwa metseselegae go itirela ka bobona.

src_text: they want to bridge the urbanrural divide in access to government services and private sector resources.
tgt_text: ba batla go tswalela sekgala se se leng teng magareng ga metseseteropo le metsesele gae fa go tla mo go fitlheleleng ditirelo tsa puso le metswedi ya lekala la poraefete.

src_text: what they would like to see is for rural areas to become centres of economic activity, industry and employment opportunity.
tgt_text: ba batla go bona metse selegae e fetoga go nna mafelo a a nang le ditiragalo tsa ikonomi, a diintaseteri le a a tlholang ditšhono tsa ditiro.

src_text: this mirrors the aspirations of the district development model (ddm), which was launched in 2019. traditional leaders are well positioned to ensure that district plans are informed by and respond to the real needs of communities and that they reflect the lived reality in rural areas.
tgt_text: seno se tsamaisana le leano la tiragatso ya kabo ya ditirelo le le ikaegileng ka ditikologo (ddm), le le thankolotsweng ka ngwaga wa 2019. baeteledipele ba merero ya setso maemo a bona a ba kgontsha go latlhela tlhase legong go netefatsa gore maano a tikologo a logiwa go lebilwe dintlha tse di rileng le go a kgontsha go samagana le ditlhokwa tse di kwa se tlhoeng mo tikologong eo le gore maano ano a tsamaisana le maemo a batho ba phelang ka fa tlase ga ona.

src_text: just as the ddm supports localised programmes that focus on the needs, strengths and opportunities in specific areas, traditional leaders have pioneered their own approach to local economic development.
tgt_text: fela jaaka ddm e tshegetsa matsholo a a ditikologo ka go samaganang le ditlhokwa, mafolofolo le ditšhono tsa lefelo le lengwe le le lengwe, baeteledipele ba merero ya setso le bona ba setse ba su tlheletse ka dikgato tsa bona tsa go tlhabolola ikonomi ya ditikologo tsa bona.

src_text: they have developed the investrural masterplan, which was launched in north west last month.
tgt_text: ba tlhomile leanokonokono la dipeeletso mo metsesele gaeng, le le thankgolotsweng kwa porofenseng ya bokone bophirima mo kgweding e e fetileng.

src_text: it is greatly encouraging that traditional leaders have rallied behind the plan and want to work with local authorities to ensure it is a success.
tgt_text: go a itumedisa gore baeteledipele ba merero ya setso ba eme nokeng leano leno mme ba batla go dirisana le dipuso tsa dikgaolo tsa bona go netefatsa gore leano leno le a atlega.

src_text: during the debate in the national house of traditional leaders it was proposed that a major success factor for the investrural programme is that traditional structures are trained, strengthened and capacitated.
tgt_text: mo dingangisanong tseno tsa ntlo ya bosetšhaba ya dikgosi go ne ga tshitshi ngwa gore selo se segolo se se tla dirang gore leanoko nokono leno la dipeeletso mo metseselegaeng le atlege ke go isa baeteledipele ba me rero ya setso katisong gore ba matlafadiwe le go tlamelwa ka bokgoni.

src_text: a number of participants outlined economic plans that are already in advanced stages of development.
tgt_text: bannaleseabe ba le bantsi ba tlhagisitse maano a bona a ikonomi a a setseng a ga tetsepele thata.

src_text: these range from agricultural projects to bioprospecting to renewable energy.
tgt_text: ona a ka ga diporojeke tsa temothuo, tiriso ya dimela le ditshedi tse di farologaneng go tlhagisa melemo le a ntšhwafatso ya motlakase.

src_text: what was evident is that the institution of traditional leadership understands that professionalisation is necessary for rural businesses in the form of small, medium and micro enterprises and cooperatives to become part of the mainstream economy.
tgt_text: se se tlhamaletseng ke gore setheo sa boeteledipele jwa merero ya setso se tlhalo ganya sentle gore tiro ya ma nontlhotlho ke seo dikgwe bo tsa metseselegae se e tlho kang mabapi le dikoporasi tsa dikgwebopotlana, tsa mo magareng le tse dikgolwane (dismme), go dira gore di kgone go nna karolo ya iko nomi ya naga.

src_text: the traditional leaders who spoke presented their vision of ‘developmental monarchs’, who see themselves as not just custodians of heritage but also as drivers of economic prosperity and progress.
tgt_text: baeteledipele ba merero ya setso ba ba neng ba latlhela tlhase legong ba tlhagisitse ponelopele ya bona ka 'ma gosi a a tlisang tlhabologo' mme ba itsaya gore ga se fela basomarelangwao mme gape ke bona ba ba ka tlisang ka tlego le kgatelopele mo ikono ming.

src_text: they have identified several projects and economic opportunities that will create jobs and improve livelihoods in rural areas.
tgt_text: ba nopotse diporojeke di le mmalwa le ditšhono tsa ikonomi tse di tla tlholang di tiro le go tokafatsa matshelo a batho ba metseselegae.

src_text: traditional leaders have also expressed their willingness to play an active part in the land reform process.
tgt_text: baeteledipele ba merero ya setso ba tlhagisitse gape gore ba ithaopa go nna le seabe mo dithulaganyong tsa pusetso ya dinaga.

src_text: since 2018, traditional leaders have made around 1 500 000 hectares of communal land available for development, and it is hoped this will increase in future.
tgt_text: fa e sale ngwaga wa 2018, baeteledipele ba merero ya setso ba tlhagisitse bogolo jwa naga ya metsese legae jo bo kanaka diheketara di le 1 500 000 gore e beetswe tlhabologo, mme ba solofela gore mo isagong bogolo jono bo tla okediwa.

src_text: to develop a coordinated and sustainable strategy, we have agreed to hold a presidential land summit in the next year.
tgt_text: gore re tlhagise leano le le rulagantsweng sentle le le tla nnelang ruri, re dumelane gore mo ngwageng o o tlang re tla tshwara kopano ya kantoro ya moporesitente e e ka ga merero ya mafatshe.

src_text: this will discuss pressing issues around land reform and its impact on communal land, much of which is located in rural areas.
tgt_text: mo kopanong eno re tla sekaseka dintlha tse di re fa rafareng tse di ka ga pusetso ya dinaga le seabe sa ntlha eno mo dinageng tsa metse selsegae, tse bontsi jwa tsona bo leng mo dinagamagaeng.

src_text: the tone of the debate in the national house was a fitting reflection of a climate in which economic recovery is foremost among our considerations.
tgt_text: lentswe le le neng le rena mo ntlong ya bosetšhaba ya dikgosi le ne le bontsha tota gore tsosoloso ya ikonomi ke selo se se kwa setlhoeng mo dikgatong tsotlhe tsa rona tsa botlhokwa.

src_text: at the same time it was a promising signal that traditional leaders appreciate their role in being part of the national recovery effort through being proactive and innovative.
tgt_text: e bile gape lentswe leno e ne e le sesupo se se re bontshang gore bae teledipele ba merero ya setso ba rata maemo a bona jaaka ba batla go nna le seabe mo dikgatong tsa go tsosolosa ikonomi ya naga ka go nna le matlhagatlhaga le boitshi mololedi mo mererong eno.

src_text: the most fitting legacy of great leaders is that the seeds of development they sow during their tenure grow into mighty trees that protect and shelter their communities for posterity.
tgt_text: se se botlhokwa thata ga jaana ke gore seo baeteledi pele ba merafe ba se dirang jaanong e tshwanetse go nna boswa jo bo tla nnelang ruri jo le dikokoma tsa ka moso di tla unngwelwang mo go sona.

src_text: as we work together as a country to rebuild our economy, we will continue to count on the support of the institution of traditional leadership, which is an inextricable part of our past, our present and our future.
tgt_text: baeteledipele ba merero ya setso ba na le seabe se se botlhokwa mo go tsosoloseng ikonomi ya rona vukuzenzeke unnamed mo dikgweding di le mmalwa tse di fetileng re ne ra tshwanela ke go laelana le dikgosi di le pedi tse di tlotliwang tsa naga ya rona ka di iketse badimong.

src_text: religious community vital in the fight against covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed recently many south africans of faith have joined others across the world in important religious observances.
tgt_text: bakereki ba na le seabe se se botlhokwa se ba ka se dirang mo go lwantsheng covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed sešweng jaana maaforika borwa a le mantsi a badu medi ba tshwaragane le ba bangwe mo go ketekeng meletlo e e botlhokwa ya sedumedi.

src_text: members of the jewish faith celebrated pesach, chris tians observed easter and muslims will soon be observing the holy month of ramadan.
tgt_text: badumedi ba tumelo ya sejuta mo ma lobeng ba ne ba keteka pa seka, bakeresete ba ne ba keteka tsogo ya morena mme mamoselema bona e se kgale ba tla bo ba ke teka kgwedi ya boitshepo ya ramadan.

src_text: for the second year, these occasions have been marked in the midst of a devastating global pandemic that has cost the lives of more than 2.5 million people across the world.
tgt_text: e setse e le ngwaga wa bo bedi mekete eno e ketekiwa re aparetswe ke leroborobo le le setlhogo le le aparetseng lefatshe lotlhe le ga jaana le setseng le fetile ka matshelo a batho ba le dimilione di le pedi le halofo mo lefatsheng.

src_text: faithbased organisations have been vital to our national response to the disease, not only providing spiritual comfort and guidance, but also by caring for those most vulnerable to the effects of the pandemic, including through the provision of food, shelter and other social services.
tgt_text: mekgatlho ya badumedi ga e a bolo go nna le seabe se se botlhokwa mo dikgatong tsa naga ya rona tsa go sama gana le bolwetse jono, e seng fela ka go re rapelela, mme gape le ka go tlhokomela bao ba neng ba tlhoka thuso mo ditsuatseng tsa leroborobo leno, mmogo le go fana ka dijo, marobalo le ka ditirelo tse dingwe tsa tlhokomelo ya baagi.

src_text: religion plays an important role in the lives of millions of south africans, and congregational worship forms a vital part of their religious practice.
tgt_text: tumelo e na le seabe se se botlhokwa thata mo ma tshelong a dimilionemilione tsa maaforika borwa, e bile gape go rapela le le setlhopha ke karolo e nngwe gape e e botlhokwa thata mo tume long ya bona.

src_text: being able to gather for religious services is also a welcome respite from a period of great hardship for individuals, families and communities.
tgt_text: go kgona go bokana le le phuthego ke selo se go itumelelwang sona thata fa batho, malapa le baagi ba sena go tswa mo boimeng jo bo seng kana ka sepe.

src_text: it is understandable that after more than a year of labouring under restrictions on religious gatherings that the faith community are keen for a return to a semblance of normality.
tgt_text: go a tlhaloganyega gore morago ga ngwaga bakereki ba ba jarile boima jwa diki letso tsa go ya dikerekeng gore jaanong ba na le phise gelo ya go boela dikerekeng jaaka go tlwaelegile.

src_text: in recognition of the importance of congregational worship to the lives of our people, government has been engaging with the faith community.
tgt_text: ka go tlhaloganya botlho kwa jwa batho ba naga ya rona jwa go boela dikere keng, puso e ntse e buisana le bakereki ba naga ya rona.

src_text: leaders of the faith community understand and appreciate the very real danger of a new wave of covid19 infections.
tgt_text: baruti ba dikereke le bake reki ba tlhaloganya sentle e bile ba itse le kotsi eo e tlisi wang ke lekhubu le lengwe le le lengwe le lentšhwa la ditshwaetso tsa covid19 .

src_text: since the outbreak of the pandemic, religious organisations have taken proactive and positive measures to limit the spread of the disease among worshippers.
tgt_text: fa e sale leroborobo leno le runya, dikereke di tsere dikgato tse di bolokesegileng go fokotsa go anama ga bo lwetse jono mo bakereking ba tsona.

src_text: another important factor is that during the various alert levels, religious organisations have incurred substantial financial losses that threaten their sustainability.
tgt_text: enngwe ya dintlha tse di botlhokwa thata ke gore mo dikgatong tse di farologa neng tsa dikiletso, dikereke di nnile le tatlhegelo e ntsi thata ya ditšhelete e e ka dirang gore di feletse di tswaletse ruri.

src_text: as government we remain committed to working with the faith community to find workable solutions.
tgt_text: re le puso re santse re eme ka le le reng re tla tshwarisana joko eno le bakereki gore re bontshane ditharabololo tse di mosola.

src_text: at the same time, public health and safety must be our paramount consideration.
tgt_text: le fa go le jalo, boitekanelo le pabalesego ya baagi ke selo se re tshwanetseng go se tseela tlhogong.

src_text: the religious community has shown innovation and initiative in the holding of worship at a time when there was a great deal of uncertainty over the trajectory of the pandemic.
tgt_text: bakereki ba tlile ka maano le ditharabololo mo ntlheng ya go tshwara dikereke mo nakong ya fa re ne re sa tlhole re itse gore a re a ya kgotsa re a boa ka leroborobo leno.

src_text: congregational services were held online and worshippers were encouraged to pray in their homes instead of attending services.
tgt_text: dikereke di ne di tshwariwa ka inthanete mme bakereki ba ne ba rotloediwa go rapela kwa malapeng a bona go na le go tla go rapela kwa dike rekeng.

src_text: this greatly aided the national effort to contain the spread of the disease.
tgt_text: seno se nnile mosola thata mo dikgatong tsa ka fa nageng tsa go thibela go anama ga bolwetse jono.

src_text: religious leaders played a pivotal role in encouraging public adherence to health measures around important customary and cultural rituals like burials.
tgt_text: baruti ba nnile le seabe se se botlhokwa thata mo go rotloetseng baagi go ikobela ditaolelo tsa boitekanelo mo mererong e e botlhokwa ya poloko le mo meletlong ya setso.

src_text: by equal measure, our people have demonstrated their commitment to adhering to public health protocols and to social distancing.
tgt_text: go fela jaalo le ka baagi ba naga ya rona ka ba diraga ditse maikano a bona a go ikobela ditaolelo tsa boite kanelo le tsa go katogana.

src_text: and they correctly appreciate that they must continue to avoid large gatherings .
tgt_text: e bile ba itse sentle gore ba tshwanetse go tswelela go itlhokomolosa go kopanela mo go nyeumang ka batho.

src_text: we are now at a time where precaution is needed above all.
tgt_text: jaanong re mo nakong eo motho a tshwanetseng go itlhokomela thata.

src_text: the coronavirus pandemic has not been eliminated, either in our own country or around the world.
tgt_text: lerobo robo la mogare wa corona le santse le re aparetse, mo nageng ya rona le mo lefa tsheng ka bophara.

src_text: the threat of a third wave is real and everpresent.
tgt_text: kgona galo ya gore re welwe ke lekhubu la boraro e teng ya tshela.

src_text: international experience has taught us that we should not tempt fate.
tgt_text: maitemogelo a rona go tswa mo dinageng tsa boditšhabatšhaba ke gore ga re a tshwanela go kgotlha motshitshi wa dinotshe.

src_text: many countries have eased restrictions, only for there to be resurgences, necessitating the imposition of even harsher restrictions.
tgt_text: dinaga di le dintsi di ne tsa repisa dikgatokiletso tsa tsona, fela tsa lelela kgama le mogogorwane ka go iphi tlhela di le ka fa gare ga ditshwaetso tse di runyang sešwa, mme tsa iphitlhela di busetsa sekeng dikgatoki letso tse di bogale go gaisa tsa mo nakong e e fetileng.

src_text: large gatherings, whether religious or otherwise, have the potential to spread the virus, despite the application of measures around social distancing and sanitising.
tgt_text: dikopano tsa go ikentsha bodutu tse di nang le tholo gelo ya batho ba bantsi, e ka tswa e le tsa dikereke kgotsa tsa mefuta e mengwe, di na le kotsi ya go ka gasa mogare, le fa e le gore go ikobelwa ditaolelo tsa boitekanelo tsa go katogana le go itsikitletsa ka sebolayamegare.

src_text: millions of south africans have been observing an important tenet of their faith.
tgt_text: dimilione tsa maaforika borwa di ntse di obamela tumelo e e botlhokwa ya tumelo ya bona.

src_text: in a country that enshrines the right to religious freedom, all effort must be made to support our people in the exercise of this right.
tgt_text: mo nageng eo re tlotlomatsang tshwa nelo ya batho ya kgolole sego ya ditumelo tsa bona, re tshwanetse go tsaya matsapa otlhe go tshegetsa batho ba naga ya rona gore ba keteke tshwanelo eno.

src_text: and in exercising this right, we need to make sure that we do not place the rights or the lives of others at risk.
tgt_text: mme fa ba keteka tshwanelo eno ba tshwanetse go netefatsa gore ga ba tsenye mo kotsing di tshwanelo kgotsa matshelo a batho ba bangwe.

src_text: this is a principle that the religious leaders i met with fully support and appreciate.
tgt_text: eno ke ntlha e baruti ba dikereke ba ke kopaneng le bona ba dumelanang le nna ka yona.

src_text: they understand the responsibility of all people of faith – indeed of all south africans – to observe the practical measures put in place to protect people’s health and save lives.
tgt_text: ba tlhaloganya mai karabelo a bakereki botlhe ba a jarileng mo magetleng a bona – ao boammaruri a ja rilweng ke maaforika borwa otlhe – a go ikobela ditaolelo tse di leng mo tirisong tsa go boloka boitekanelo le ma tshelo a batho.

src_text: for more than a year, we have worked together as a society to contain this pandemic.
tgt_text: sebaka sa ngwaga re ntse re sikere mmogo dikgato tsa go thibela go ijala ga leroborobo leno re le setšhaba.

src_text: now as we work to overcome it, we need to reaffirm our shared determination to act responsibly and cautiously.
tgt_text: jaanong jaaka re lebagane le go fedisa matsapa ano, re tshwanetse go totobatsa maitlhomo a rona a go rwala maikarabelo le go itlhokomela.

src_text: in doing so, we will be giving practical effect to the universal messages of hope, salvation, freedom and solidarity that will be spoken of in the churches, synagogues, mosques and homes of our land in the days and weeks ahead.
tgt_text: bakereki ba na le seabe se se botlhokwa se ba ka se dirang mo go lwantsheng covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed sešweng jaana maaforika borwa a le mantsi a badu medi ba tshwaragane le ba bangwe mo go ketekeng meletlo e e botlhokwa ya sedumedi.

src_text: port of durban creates a sea of opportunities for sa vukuzenzele unnamed recently, i visit ed the port of durban to see for myself the work being done to make the port more efficient and competitive.
tgt_text: boemelakepe jwa kwa durban bo bulela ntletsentletse ya ditšhono mo nageng ya aforika borwa vukuzenzele unnamed sešweng jaana ke sa tswa go etela bo emelakepe jwa kwa durban go iponela ka bo nna tiro e go samaganweng le yona mo go direng gore boemelakepe jono bo dire ka botswapelo le ka matse tseleko.

src_text: after a briefing with the senior management of transnet, i toured the harbour in a pilot boat, which is usually used to guide large ships through the entrance channel to the pier.
tgt_text: morago ga kopano le botsa maisibogolo ba transnet, ke ne ka tsena mo seketswaneng se se supetsang dikepe tse dikgolo tsela mo boemakepeng mme ka tsena ke tswa mo dika rolong tse di farologaneng tsa boemelakepe jono.

src_text: seeing the workings of the port from the water, one is reminded of its vast scale and complexity.
tgt_text: go bona ka fao lefelo leno le dirisiwang ka teng o le mo sekepeng, seno se go gopotsa ka fao tiro ya lefelo leno e leng e kgolo ka teng le ka fao tiro ya teng e leng marara ka gone.

src_text: if the port does not function efficiently, the entire economy suffers, from importers and exporters to consumers.
tgt_text: fa boemelakepe jono bo sa dire ka manontlhotlho, lephata lotlhe la ikonomi le ka phu tlhama, re bua ka barekisi ba ditlhagisiwa tsa kwa dinageng tsa kwa ntle ka fa nageng ya rona, barekisi ba ditlhagisiwa tsa ka fa nageng ya rona kwa dinageng tsa kwa ntle go tse nyeletsa le bareki.

src_text: on the other hand, if the port works well it can drive economic growth and position our country as a gateway to the region and the continent.
tgt_text: fela ka fa letlhakoreng le lengwe ke gore fa boemelakepe jono bo dira ka manontlhotlho, bo ka godisa ikonomi le go dira gore naga ya rona e nne yona e e dirisiwang ke dinaga tse di ka fa kgaolong e e ka fa borwa ya kontinente go tsenya le go ntsha ditlhagisiwa mmogo le go dirisiwa le ke dinaga tsa kontinente ka bophara.

src_text: when i visited durban in october 2019, many local businesses and port users raised concerns with me about the performance of the durban port.
tgt_text: fa ke ne ke etetse durban ka diphalane 2019, dikgwebo di le dintsi mmogo le badirisi ba boemelakepe jono mo kgaolong eo ba ne ba tlhagisa dingo ngorego tsa bona mo go nna mabapi le ka fao boemelakepe jwa kwa durban bo dirang ka gone.

src_text: shipping companies, in particular, expressed concern about truck congestion and waiting times, ship berthing delays and anchorage times, poor maintenance of equipment and generally low productivity in the port.
tgt_text: ditlamo tse di rwalang dithoto di ngongoregile thata ka tshu betlhelano ya diteroko mmogo le sebaka se se engwang, tiegiso ya dikepe pele di ka folosa kgo tsa go pega morwalo mmogo le dinako tse di farologaneng tse di dirisiwang mo mabopong, go se tlhokomelo le go se tsosolose didirisiwa, meago le dithoto ka tshwanelo mmogo le go se dire ka botswapelo ga boemelakepe jono.

src_text: my recent visit to the port was to check whether the commitments made in response to these concerns had been implemented.
tgt_text: leeto la me la sešweng jaana le ne le le mabapi le go lekola gore ditsholofetso tse di neng tsa diriwa go rarabolola dingo ngorego tseno di feleditse di diragaditswe kgotsa jang.

src_text: there has indeed been great progress over the past year in turning around the performance of the port, despite the impact of covid19.
tgt_text: tota go na le kgatelopele e kgolo e e dirilweng mo ngwa geng yo o fetileng mo go toka fatseng tiro ya boemelakepe jono, le fa tota covid19 e re sitisitse.

src_text: these efforts are already showing results in improved maintenance of equipment, reduced congestion, quicker turnaround times and increased use of rail instead of road transport.
tgt_text: matsapa a a tserweng a setse a bonagala fa go tla mo tlhoko melong le mo tsosolosong ya didirisiwa, meago le dithoto, tshubetlhelano e fokotsegile, ga go sa emiwa sebaka mme e beli gape go setse go dirisiwa diterene ka bontsi go na le go dirisa dirori le diteroko.

src_text: while this is important progress, there is still much work to be done to position durban as a worldclass port and as a hub port for the southern hemisphere.
tgt_text: le fa kgatelopele eno e le botlhokwa, go santse go na le namane e tona ya tiro e e santse ng e saletse morago mo go direng gore boemelakepe jwa durban bo nne jwa maemo a a kwa godimo mo lefatsheng le mo maemong a kgaolo ya dinaga tse di ka fa letlhakoreng la borwa mo kontinenteng.

src_text: in recent years, the port has slipped from its position as first in africa to third, behind tangier in morocco and port said in egypt.
tgt_text: mo dingwageng tse di fetileng, boemelakepe jono bo ntshitswe mo maemong a ntlha a bo neng bo le mo go ona mo kontine nteng go ya mo maemong a boraro, mo bo salang morago boemelakepe jwa tangier kwa morocco le boemelakepe jwa said kwa egepeta.

src_text: truck turnaround times have greatly improved.
tgt_text: go diega ga dirori le dite roko le gone go fokotsegile thata.

src_text: similarly, the reliability of cargo handling equipment has improved to 80% and is heading towards at least 95% to meet international benchmarks.
tgt_text: go fela jalo le ka didi risiwa tse di rwalang dithoto le merwalo ka 80% ya tsona di baakantswe mme ga jaa nong go gaufi le go dira gore 95% ya tsona di baakanngwe sentle go fitlhelela maemo a a beilweng a boditšhabatšhaba.

src_text: ship waiting times have reduced to impressive levels.
tgt_text: sebaka se dikepe di se emang se fokotsegile ka mokgwa o o gagamatsang thata.

src_text: these statistics may seem technical and obscure, but they have a direct impact on the growth of our economy and on the prices we pay as consumers.
tgt_text: dipalopalo tseno di ka tswa di bonagala e le tsa setegeniki e bile di sa tlhaloganyege, fela di na le seabe mo kgolong ya iko noming ya rona le mo mading a re a duelelang fa re reka dilo.

src_text: we have made improving the efficiency of our ports a priority of operation vulindlela and have focused on rebuilding transnet, which is one of our valued stateowned enterprises.
tgt_text: re beile kwa setlhoeng dikga to tsa go tlhabolola tiro ya maemelakepe a rona go nna ya maemo a a kwa godimo ka go dirisa letsholo la operation vulindlela mme e bile gape re tsepamisitse mogopolo mo go tsosoloseng transnet, e leng se sengwe sa ditheo tse di botlho kwa tsa puso ya rona.

src_text: the new management of transnet and its operating divisions are resolutely focused on turning the performance of the port around.
tgt_text: ba bolaodi jo bontšhwa jwa transnet mmogo le ba maphata a bona a go diragatsa tiro ba ikemiseditse go fetola tiro e e bokoa ya boemelakepe jono.

src_text: the management has ambitious and exciting expansion plans for all five of the port’s precincts.
tgt_text: ba bolaodi ba na le maano a magolo a a itumedisang a go atolosa lefelo leno mo dikaro long tsotlhe di le tlhano tsa lona.

src_text: these include the deepening of the maydon wharf channel to allow larger, modern vessels to enter the port, the infill of pier 1 and pier 2 to create additional capacity for con tainers and the development of a new container terminal in the point precinct.
tgt_text: ona a tsenyeletsa a go atolosa lefelobotseno la maydon wharf go dira gore le dikepe tse dikgo lo le tsa sešweng di kgone go tsena mo boemelakepeng jono, go atolosa lefelopeelo la dithoto le merwalo la lefelopeelo la ntlha le la lefelopeelo la bo bedi go thusa gore a kgone go amogela dikhontheinara di le dintsi tsa dithoto le merwalo mmogo le go aga lefelo le le ntšhwa la pholosetso ya dithoto le merwalo mo lefelong le go folosetswang dithoto le me rwalo mo go lona.

src_text: altogether, the expansion of infrastructure at the port will require r100 billion in new investment over the next decade and more.
tgt_text: madi otlhe a a tla tlhokagalang go tswa mo dipeeletsong tse dintšhwa mo go atoloseng ma faratlhatlha a boemelakepe jono a ka dira r100 bilione mo seba keng sa dingwaga di le lesome kgotsa go feta tse di tlang.

src_text: this will completely transform the port, expanding its capacity for container handling from 2.9 million units to more than 11 million units.
tgt_text: seno se tla fetola boemelakepe jono gotlhelele, mo bogolo jwa bona bo tla amogelang dikhonthei nara tsa dithoto le merwalo di le dimilione di le 11 go gaisa ga jaanong mo bo amogelang dikhontheinara di le dimilione di le 2.9 fela.

src_text: these ambitious plans will require greater private sector participation and investment.
tgt_text: maano a magolo ano a tla tlhoka gore lekala la poraefete le nne le seabe se segolo le go dira dipeeletso.

src_text: transnet, including the durban port, is an important national asset belonging to the people of south africa.
tgt_text: transnet, mmogo le boemelakepe jwa durban ke di theo tse di botlhokwa tsa naga tse e leng tsa baagi ba aforika borwa.

src_text: partnerships with the private sector are crucial to bring new investment, technology and expertise to port operations and to modernise equipment and infrastructure.
tgt_text: tirisanommogo le lekala la poraefete e botlhokwa mo go ngokeleng dipeeletso tse dintšhwa, thekenoloji le kitso e leng tseo di tla dirisiwang mo ditirong tsa boemelakepele mmogo le go tlisa didirisiwa le mafaratlhatlha a segompieno.

src_text: transnet is planning, for example, to advertise a concession later this year to build and operate the new point terminal.
tgt_text: go naya motlhala, transnet monongwaga e ikaelela go phasalatsa lekwalotumelano la go aga le go tsamaisa lefelo le lentšhwa la pholosetso ya dithoto le merwalo.

src_text: this will bring in private investment and improve the efficiency of container handling.
tgt_text: seno se tla ngokela dipeeletso go tswa mo makaleng a poraefete mmogo le go tokafatsa ka fao dikho ntheinara di tlhokomelwang ka teng.

src_text: through our reform process we are steadily improving the efficiency of our ports and railways and unlocking massive investment in infrastructure.
tgt_text: ka dikgato tsa rona tsa go fe tola batsholateu, gannyane ga nnyane re tsweletse go tokafa tsa tiro ya maemelakepe a rona mmogo le ya diterene gore re kgone go bulela dipeeletso tse dintsi mo mafaratlhatlheng a rona.

src_text: this will not only lower costs and improve the competitiveness of our exports, but will create thousands of new jobs in the process.
tgt_text: seno se ka se fokotse fela ditlhwatlhwa tse re di duelelang mmogo le go tokafatsa maemo gore re kgone go gaisana le ma felo a mangwe a diromelantle, mme gape se tla tlhola ditiro di le diketekete.

src_text: through both operational improvements and structural reforms, durban port will reclaim its place as the bestperforming port in africa.
tgt_text: ka go tokafatsa tiro ya boema kepe le go tsosolosa meago ya jona, boemakepe jwa durban bo tla boela mo maemong a bona a go nna boemakepe bo bo dirang sentle thata mo aforika.

src_text: as part of our reconstruction and recove ry plan, we will continue to work tirelessly to expand infrastructure investment and transform our network industries.
tgt_text: jaaka e le karolo ya leano la rona la tsosoloso le kagosešwa ya ikonomi, re tla tswelela go dira ka natla go oketsa di peeletso mo mafaratlhatlheng mmogo le go fetola diintaseteri tsa rona.

src_text: if my visit to durban left one thing in my mind, it is that we south africans are capable of succeeding in projects of vast importance and scale.
tgt_text: fa go na le sengwe se leeto la me kwa durban se setseng mo mogopolong wa me ke gore, re le maaforika borwa re na le bokgoni jwa go ka atlega mo diporojekeng tse dikgolo le tse di botlhokwa thata.

src_text: our ambitions should match the size of our challenges.
tgt_text: maikaelelo a rona a tshwa netse go tsamaelana le bogolo jwa dikgwetlho tsa rona.

src_text: with the progress we are making at the durban port, with the reinvigorated skills and capabilities that we have in transnet, we now have the wind in our sails.
tgt_text: ka kgatelopele e re tsweletse ng go e bona kwa boemelake peng jwa durban, ka bokgoni jo bontšhwa jo re tswelelang go bo bona kwa transnet, jaanong re na le maatla a go diragatsa seo re tshwane tseng go se dira.

src_text: and we are moving at a rate of knots towards our destination.
tgt_text: boemelakepe jwa kwa durban bo bulela ntletsentletse ya ditšhono mo nageng ya aforika borwa vukuzenzele unnamed sešweng jaana ke sa tswa go etela bo emelakepe jwa kwa durban go iponela ka bo nna tiro e go samaganweng le yona mo go direng gore boemelakepe jono bo dire ka botswapelo le ka matse tseleko.

src_text: robust media more critical than ever vukuzenzele unnamed we live in a country where not just journalists but any member of the public is able to freely articulate their views, their opinions and indeed their dissatisfaction without fear of retribution.
tgt_text: bobegakgang jwa bogatlhamelamasisi jaanong bo tlhokagala thata go feta mo malobeng vukuzenzele unnamed re tshela mo na geng eo baagi, e seng fela babega kgang, ba gololesegileng go ka ntsha maikutlo a bona, seo ba se akanyang le dingongorego tsa bona ntle le go boifa gore ba ka tle ba gatelelwa.

src_text: we have come a long way from the days where social protest by artists attracted banning orders, and critical reporting by journalists risked imprisonment or the closure of publications.
tgt_text: re tswa kgakala mo badira gatsi ba neng ba ilediwa go diragatsa fa e le gore ba dira ditshupetso mo mererong ya loago, mo babegakgang ba ba neng ba utulola diphiri ba neng ba otlhaiwa ka go tshwariwa kgotsa go tswalela lefelo leo ba neng ba le direla.

src_text: recently, the organisation reporters without borders published the 2021 world press freedom index, a barometer of the state of media freedom across the globe.
tgt_text: sešweng jaana mokgatlho wa babegakgang ba ba sa beelwang melelwane o phasaladitse pegelo ya kgo lolesego ya makwalodikgang mo lefatsheng ya ngwaga wa 2021, e leng pegelo e e bontshang ka fao bobega kgang bo gololesegileng go dira tiro ya jona ka teng mo lefatsheng lotlhe.

src_text: overall, it was found that there has been a decline in public access to information and an increase in obstacles to news coverage in a number of countries.
tgt_text: go fitlhetswe gore ka gotlhe tshedimosetso ga e sa tswa ka fao e tshwanetseng mme e bile gape dikgoreletsi tsa go bega dikgang di tlhatlogile mo dinageng di le dintsi nyana.

src_text: the report said that journalism is "totally blocked or seriously impeded" in 73 countries and "constrained" in 59 others.
tgt_text: pegelo eno e re bobega kgang "bo thibetswe ka go tlhelele go dira tiro ya jona" mo dinageng di le 73 mme gape mo dinageng di le 59 "bo a kgorelediwa".

src_text: what is worrying is that media freedom has deteriorated under the covid19 pandemic, with the various restrictions put in place having seemingly been used to curtail media activity in several places.
tgt_text: se se tshwenyang tota ke gore mo pakeng ya lerobo robo la covid19 kgolo lesego ya bobegakgang go itlhokomolositswe yona thata, mme melaokiletso e e farologaneng e e tsentsweng tirisong e ntse e dirisiwa go thibela tiro ya bobegakgang mo dikgaolong di le dintsi nyana.

src_text: in this latest report south africa ranked 32nd out of 180 countries.
tgt_text: mo pegelong eno ya sešweng aforika borwa e mo maemong a bo 32 mo di nageng di le 180. pegelo eno e tlhalosa gore kgololesego ya bobegakgang mo nageng ya aforika borwa "e enngwe nokeng fela e santse e na le makoa a yona".

src_text: the index describes the state of media freedom in south africa as "guaranteed but fragile".
tgt_text: e tlhalosa gore le fa mo laotheo wa naga ya aforika borwa o sireletsa kgololesego eno e bile gape e le setlwaedi gore bobegakgang bo dira dipatlisiso, go santse go na le dikgoreletsi di le dintsinyana tse di kgoreletsang babega kgang go dira tiro ya bona.

src_text: it notes that while the south african constitution protects freedom and we have an established culture of investigative journalism, a number of impediments still hinder journalists in the performance of their duties.
tgt_text: tseno di tsenyeletsa go isiwa kwa kgotlatshekelo fa ba tsaya ditshwantsho tsa meago e e botlhokwa ya puso kgotsa fa ba bega ka sengwe se se amanang le tshirele tsego ya puso.

src_text: this includes legal injunctions against taking images of national key points or reporting on matters involving state security.
tgt_text: pegelo eno gape e nopola le matshosetsi a a tlhatlogang a go tshosetsa babegakgang mo ngwageng wa 2020, bogolo jang babegakgang ba bomme a a diriwang mo mafaratlha tlheng a ditlhaeletsano.

src_text: the report also notes an increase during 2020 of the intimidation of journalists, especially female journalists on social media.
tgt_text: ditiragalo tsa matshosetsi tsa mothale ono ga di amo gelesege ka gope, bogolo jang fa di totile babegakgang ba bomme e bile ka dinako dingwe di ba tshosetsa ka go ba betelela.

src_text: such intimidation is totally unacceptable, but is particularly harmful when it is directed at female journalists and is occasionally accompanied by threats of sexual violence.
tgt_text: eno ke ntlha e e re tshwenyang tota mme ga se selo se se tla letlelelwang.

src_text: this is a matter of great concern and cannot be allowed.
tgt_text: le fa go le jalo, re itumelela kitso ya gore mo nageng ya rona re na le bobegakgang jo bo gololesegileng jwa boga tlhamelamasisi jo bo begang dikgang ntle le go tshaba kana go tsaya letlhakore la bao ba busang, bo bega ka dintlha tse di tlhobaetsang tse re tshelang mo go tsona, mmogo le go begela baagi tshedimosetso e e nepileng e e sa sokamang.

src_text: at the same time, we take great comfort in the knowledge that we have a free, robust media that is able to report without fear or favour about those in power, about the most pressing social issues of our time, and to provide accurate, impartial information to the public.
tgt_text: mo nakong eno gore re kgone go thusana go tsoso losa ikonomi ya naga ya rona le setšhaba sa borona mo leroborobong la mogare wa corona , re tlhoka bobe gakgang jo bo gatlhamelang masisi.

src_text: at a time when we are working together to rebuild our economy and our society in the midst of the coronavirus pandemic, a robust media is more critical than ever.
tgt_text: babegakgang ba aforika borwa ba nnile le seabe se se botlhokwa thata mo go utuloleng kitso e ga jaana re nang le yona ka ga bogolo jwa dikgato tsa go goga puso ka nko tseo di neng di diriwa ke batho ba ba ikgathalelang ba le esi, ba ba bonweenwee mmogo le ditheo tseo ba di direlang.

src_text: the south african media has played a pivotal role in uncovering much of what we know today about the true extent of capture of the state by selfserving, corrupt individuals and entities.
tgt_text: ba ne ba tswelela go bega dikgang tsa bona le fa ba ne ba tshosediwa, ba fiwa tshedi mosetso e e fosagetseng le go sotliwa.

src_text: they sustained their reporting even in the face of intimidation, disinformation and attacks on their person.
tgt_text: bonweenwee ke jone kgwe tlho e le esi e naga ya rona e tobaneng le jone.

src_text: corruption is by no means the only challenge we face as a country.
tgt_text: ka ntlha ya jone, maaforika borwa a le mantsi letsatsi le letsatsi a tshelela mo khumanegong e bile ga ba thusiwe, ga ba lekane e se meno, ba abelwa kabo ya ditirelo e e bokoa e bile ga ba neelwe ditšhono.

src_text: the daily lives of many south africans are still affected by poverty, inequality and underdevelopment, poor service delivery and lack of access to opportunities.
tgt_text: fa bobegakgang bo batla go tswelela ka tiro ya jone ya go tshegetsa temokerasi, babegakgang ba rona ba tshwanetse go se fele lentswe mo go begeng dikgang ntle le go tshaba kgotsa go tsaya le tlhakore ka merero e mengwe e e diragalang e re tshelang mo go yona.

src_text: if the media is to remain true to its responsibility to support democracy, our journalists must continue to report without fear or favour on the other issues of the day.
tgt_text: ba tshwanetse go bega dikgang tse di ka ga pogiso e e totileng batho ba bong jo bo rileng (gbv), bosenyi mo metseng e re nnang mo go yona mmogo le maitshwaro a a bodileng mo baaging a a jaaka tirisobotlhawa ya diritibatsi.

src_text: their sustained coverage must include genderbased violence, crime in our communities and social ills like substance abuse.
tgt_text: bobegakgang jwa naga ya rona bo tshwanetse go bega dikgang tse di nang le tshedi mosetso e e nepileng e e sa tseyeng letlhakore, go thusa baagi gore ba kgone go itseela ditshwetso ka tshedimosetso eno, gore ba kgone go iponela ditšhono ba tle ba tokafatse matshelo a bona.

src_text: our media should provide accurate and impartial information, enabling the public to make informed decisions, to access opportunities and to improve their lives.
tgt_text: ba tshwanetse go tswelela go diragatsa bobegakgang jo bo sa lebelelang fela gore ba tlhagise ditlhogo tse di ngokelang le dikgang tse di gatisiwang mo letlakaleng la ntlha la makwalodikgang mme di tswela batho mosola.

src_text: they should continue to produce journalism that goes beyond the headlines and front pages and that contributes to human development.
tgt_text: ba tshwanetse go bega dikgang tse di itumedisang le tseo di sa itumediseng, kgatelopele e re e dirang le dikgwetlho tse re tsamayang re kopana le tsona.

src_text: they should report both the good news and the bad news, the progress we make and the challenges we face.
tgt_text: go tshepagala ke selo se se botlhokwa thata se se dirang gore baagi ba tshepe babe gakgang.

src_text: credibility is key to sustaining trust between journalists and the public.
tgt_text: fa babegakgang ba letlelela go dirisiwa kana gore di rala tsa bona di dirisediwe go emelela boradipolotiki ba ba rileng le go lwantshana le boradipolotiki ba ba rileng kgotsa gona go dirisediwa go ipusuletsana le go betsana ka noga e tshela, baagi ba latlhe gelwa ke tshepo mo go bona.

src_text: when journalists allow themselves or their platforms to be used to fight political battles or settle scores on behalf of vested interests, their credibility suffers.
tgt_text: fa babegakgang ba phasalatsa dikgang tse di senang nnete kgotsa tseo ba itseng sentle gore ga se tsa boammaruri, baagi ba latlhe gelwa ke tshepo mo go bona.

src_text: when media disseminate stories that are inaccurate or that they know to be false, the public loses faith in them.
tgt_text: botlhe ba ba ratang naga eno ya rona mme ba eletsa gore e ka atlega ba tshwanetse go ema nokeng bobegakgang jwa ka fa nageng ya rona, le go netefatsa gore ga bo kgorelediwe mo go direng tiro ya jona.

src_text: it is in the best interests of all who love this country and wish for it to succeed that our media is supported, and not hindered in its work.
tgt_text: re le baagi, tla re tsweleleng go dirisana mmogo gore re sireletse kgololesego ya bobe gakgang ba naga ya rona.

src_text: as a society, let us continue to work together to jealously safeguard our country’s media freedom.
tgt_text: bobegakgang jwa bogatlhamelamasisi jaanong bo tlhokagala thata go feta mo malobeng vukuzenzele unnamed re tshela mo na geng eo baagi, e seng fela babega kgang, ba gololesegileng go ka ntsha maikutlo a bona, seo ba se akanyang le dingongorego tsa bona ntle le go boifa gore ba ka tle ba gatelelwa.

src_text: israel, palestine urged to emulate sa by pursuing peace vukuzenzele unnamed our experience with the democratic transition is a lesson about the power of empathy, negotiation and compromise.
tgt_text: naga ya iseraele le ya palestina di rotloediwa gore di itseele malebela mo nageng ya aforika borwa ka go kgaratlhela kagiso mo dinageng ka bobedi vukuzenzele unnamed maitemogelo a rona mo go nneng le puso ya temokerasi ke seo re ithu tileng sona fa go tla mo ku tlwelobotlhokong, ditheri sanong le mo go ikentsheng setlhabelo.

src_text: the escalating situation in israel and palestine affirms once more what we south africans know too well, that intractable conflicts can only be solved through peaceful negotiation.
tgt_text: ntwa ya matlho a mahibidu e e tsweletseng go tuka ma lakabe magareng ga naga ya palestina le ya iseraele e totobatsa se rona maaforika borwa re se tlhaloganyang sentle mme sona ke gore se tlhare sa dikgogakgogano ke go nna fatshe le buisane le go bontshana mabaka ka kagiso.

src_text: it also demonstrates that unless the root causes of a conflict are addressed, in this case the illegal occupation by israel of palestinian land and the denial of the palestinian people’s right to selfdetermination, there will never be peace.
tgt_text: e re bontsha gape le gore fa mmidi wa bothata jo bo leng teng o sa utololwe ga go kitla go rena kagiso, mme jona ke jwa naga ya iseraele ka go thopa ka dikgoka naga ya mapalestina mmogo le go ba tseela ditshwanelo le dithata tsa go itlhophela gore ba batla go busiwa ke mang.

src_text: the latest violence was sparked by an israeli court decision to evict a group of families from their homes in the sheikh jarrah neighbourhood in east jerusalem to make way for israeli settlements.
tgt_text: ntwa ya sešweng jaana e bakilwe ke katlholo ya kgotlatshekelo ya iseraele ya go koba malapa a mapale stina mo nageng ya bona kwa sheikh jarrah e e leng gaufi le botlhaba jwa jerusalema e le maitlhomo a go tsaya naga eo gore maiseraele a age mo nageng eo.

src_text: the sight of men, women and children being evicted from the homes their families have lived in for generations brings back painful collective and personal memories for the majority of south africans – of forced removals and land dispossession.
tgt_text: go bona banna, basadi le bana ba ntshiwa ka dikgoka mo dintlong tseo dikokoma tsa malapa a bona di nnileng mo mafelong ao sebaka sa dijarajara e re gopotsa mahu tsana ao bontsi jwa maaforika borwa a fetileng mo go ona a go ntshiwa mo mafatsheng a rona ka dikgoka.

src_text: it was a pain and humiliation faced by my own family, and by many south african families.
tgt_text: e ne e le lenyatso le le utlwi sang botlhoko leo ba lelapa la gaetsho mmogo le ba malapa a le mantsi a maaforika borwa re itemogetseng lona.

src_text: my family was forcibly moved to different parts of the country on two occasions.
tgt_text: ba lelapa la gaetsho ba ne ba ntshiwa ka dikgoka makgetlho a le mabedi mo ba neng ba nna me ba fudusetswa kwa mafelong a a farologaneng ka fa nageng.

src_text: being forced from one’s home at gunpoint is a trauma not easily forgotten and is carried across generations.
tgt_text: go ntshiwa kwa lapeng la gaeno o supilwe ka tlhobolo ke selo se se roromisang mmele e bile ga se selo se se lebalegang, ke selo se se gopolwang le ke dikokoma tse di tlang.

src_text: as a country, we are still living with the residual effects of the callous acts carried out in the name of apartheid spatial planning.
tgt_text: ka fa nageng re santse re tshelela mo ditlamoragong tse di tlhodilweng ke dikgato tsa puso ya tlhaolele tsa go rulaganya mafelo a bodulo.

src_text: for all who believe in equality, justice and human rights, we cannot but be moved and indeed angered, at the pain and humiliation being inflicted on the palestinian people; for it echoes our own.
tgt_text: rotlhe fa re le batho mme re dumela mo go lekalekaneng ga batho, bosiamisi le di tshwanelo tsa batho, re retele lwa ke go itshokela tšhakgalo e re leng mo go yona ya go bona batho ba ba jaaka rona ba mapalestina ba utlwisiwa botlhoko le go sotliwa jaaka go diragala; gonne seno se re gopotsa koo re tswang.

src_text: israel’s actions are a violation of international law.
tgt_text: se iseraele e se dirang ke go gatakaka melao ya boditšhabatšhaba.

src_text: they show a total disregard for successive united nations security council reso lutions that call for an end to the occupation of palestinian land and for the fulfilment of the rights of the palestinian people.
tgt_text: e bontsha lenyatso le le tseneletseng la ditshwetso tse di tserweng ke lekgotla la tshireletso la dinagakopano tse di laelang gore iseraele e kgaotse go tsaya naga ya mapalestina ka dikgoka mmogo le go kgaotsa go gatakaka ditshwanelo tsa mapalestina.

src_text: since israeli security forces launched assaults on worshippers at alaqsa mosque in jerusalem, the violence has now engulfed the gaza strip, large parts of the west bank and a number of israeli cities.
tgt_text: fa e sale sesole sa iseraele se simolola go tlhasela barapedi kwa mosekeng wa al aqsa kwa jerusalema mo bekeng e e fetileng, ntwa eno jaanong e setse e aparetse le gaza strip, dikarolo tse dintsi tsa west bank mmogo le diteropo di le dintsinyana tsa iseraele.

src_text: it has claimed the lives of dozens of people, including children.
tgt_text: ntwa eno e setse e fetile ka bontsi jwa matshelo a batho, go tsenyeletsa le a bana.

src_text: it is also deeply troubling that israeli forces destroyed a multistorey building that housed a number of media organisations, sending a chilling message to media reporting on the violence.
tgt_text: ntlha e nngwe e e tshwe nyang tota ke gore sesole sa iseraele se phutlhamisitse moago o o tlhatlhaganeng o ditlamo di le dintsinyana tsa bobegakgang di neng di direla mo go ona, seno se tsitsibanya mmele mme se re bontsha matshosetsi a bobegakgang bo tobanang le ona fa bo bega ka ntwa eno e e runtseng.

src_text: the senseless and continued israeli bombardment of gaza will have devastating consequences for more than two million people who have been suffering under an illegal israeli blockade for 14 years.
tgt_text: ditlhaselo tse di setlhogo tsa sesole sa iseraele le go pha mphololwa ga gaza go tla nna le ditlamorago tse di sa jeseng diwelang mo bathong ba feta dimilione di le pedi ba ba nang le sebaka sa dingwaga di le 14 ba parakilweng ke iseraele.

src_text: we call on all parties involved to show restraint, to respect human life and to cease the current hostilities.
tgt_text: re ikuela mo dinageng ka bobedi go emisa ntwa, go tlotla matshelo a batho ba bangwe mmogo le go baya marumo fatshe.

src_text: as south africa, we are committed to being part of international efforts aimed at reviving a political process that will lead to the establishment of a viable palestinian state existing sidebyside in peace with israel and within internationally recognised borders.
tgt_text: re le naga ya aforika borwa re ema nokeng dikgato tsa dinaga tsa boditšhabatšhaba tsa maitlhomo a go busetsa sekeng merero ya sepolotiki e e tla busetsang sekeng naga ya mapalestina e e tla dirisanang le ya iseraele, mme go rene kagiso mo melelwaneng ya dinaga ka bobedi e e tla the wang ka melao ya dinaga tsa boditšhabatšhaba.

src_text: the twostate solution remains the most viable option for the peoples of israel and palestine and must continue to be supported.

src_text: just as israeli security forces were attacking worshippers at the alaqsa mosque, we in south africa were preparing to commemorate the centenary of the bulhoek massacre at a religious site in ntabelanga in the eastern cape.
tgt_text: fa sesole sa iseraele se ne se tlhasela barapedi kwa mo sekeng wa al aqsa, rona mo nageng ya aforika borwa re ne re samagane le dithulaganyo tsa go ipaakanyetsa segopotso sa ngwagakgolo sa dipolao tsa batho ba le bantsi kwa bu lhoek mo lefelong le go neng go rapelwa kwa go lona kwa ntabelanga kwa porofenseng ya kapa botlhaba.

src_text: on 24 may 1921, colonial security forces armed with machine guns and artillery opened fire on worshippers, killing more than 160 people and wounding nearly 130. the massacre laid bare the brutality not only of the police force of the union of south africa, but also the racist system that it was charged to uphold.
tgt_text: ka la bo 24 motsheganong 1921, sesole sa puso ya bokoloniale se tlhometse ka ditlhobolo tsa meratlatla le tse di feferang se ne sa fefera barapedi le go ba nesetsa ka dikolo, mo batho ba le kanaka 160 ba neng ba bolawa mme ba ba ka dirang 130 bona ba ne ba gobadiwa.

src_text: just like the dispute in the sheik jarrah neighbourhood, the atrocity at bulhoek was not just about a local dispute; it was fundamentally about the forced dispossession of land, about colonial occupa tion, about racial discrimi nation and about the violent suppression of dissent.
tgt_text: dipolao tseno di ne tsa baya mo pepeneneng setlhogo, e seng fela sa sesole sa puso ya aforika borwa ya bokoloniale, mme gape le sa thulaganyo ya tlhaolele e e neng e e disa.

src_text: as we reflect on the crisis in the middle east and particularly on the suffering of the palestinian people, we would do well to recall the words of selby msimang, a founding member of the african national congress.
tgt_text: fela jaaka se se diragalang mo lefelong la sheik jarrah, dipolao tse di setlhogo tsa kwa bulhoek le tsona di ne di sa ikaega fela ka go se dumele lane ga dikgopolo; mo boteng jwa tsona di ne di ikaegile ka go tseela ba bangwe dithoto le naga, go thopa naga ka dikgoka, go tlhaola batho ba merafe e e rileng le go gatelela ba ba sa dumelaneng le tseno ka go dirisa dikgoka.

src_text: in the aftermath of the bulhoek massacre he wrote: "history has shown that the human soul naturally revolts against injustice".
tgt_text: fa re leba tlhakantsuke e e diragalang kwa dinageng tsa botlhabagare bogolosegolo tshotlego e mapalestina a leng ka fa gare ga yona, go tla re tswela molemo go ga kologelwa mafoko a ga selby msimang, yo le ene e leng yo mongwe wa ba ba tlhamileng mokgatlho wa dipolotiki wa african national congress.

src_text: the protests and the revolt of the oppressed people of south africa against colonialism and apartheid proved the veracity of this prophecy.
tgt_text: morago ga setlhogo sa go bolawa ga batho kwa bu lhoek o ne a kwala molaetsa a re: "hisetori e re bontshitse ka matlho gore fa mowa wa motho o sa dumelane le ditiro tse di makgwakgwa o a tle o thulane le tsona ka tlhogo".

src_text: as lovers of freedom and of justice, we stand with the palestinian people in their quest for selfdetermination, but also in their resistance against the deprivation of their human rights and the denial of their dignity.
tgt_text: megwanto le ditshupetso tse di rebotsweng ke batho ba ba neng ba gatelelwa mo aforika borwa ba lwantshana le puso ya bokoloniale mmogo le puso ya tlhaolele di paka bokao jwa ponelopele eno.

src_text: as citizens of a country that was able to turn its back on racehatred and bloodshed, and build an inclusive society rooted in human rights for all, it is our collective hope that the people of israel and palestine will follow a similar path; that they will find each other and that they will find peace.
tgt_text: naga ya iseraele le ya palestina di rotloediwa gore di itseele malebela mo nageng ya aforika borwa ka go kgaratlhela kagiso mo dinageng ka bobedi vukuzenzele unnamed maitemogelo a rona mo go nneng le puso ya temokerasi ke seo re ithu tileng sona fa go tla mo ku tlwelobotlhokong, ditheri sanong le mo go ikentsheng setlhabelo.

src_text: sa strives to realise the vision of the constitution vukuzenzele unnamed sixty years ago, on 31 may 1961, apartheid south africa became a republic, cutting its ties with the british empire.
tgt_text: aforika borwa e kgaratlhela ponelopele ya molaotheo vukuzenzele unnamed dingwaga tse di fetileng di le 60 ka la bo 31 mo tsheganong 1961 puso ya tlhaolele ya aforika borwa e ne ya tsaya legato la gore e batla go nna naga ya rephaboliki, mme ka go dira jalo e ne ya supoga mo dinaleng tsa go laolelwa ke bogosi jwa britain.

src_text: while a ‘republic’ is generally defined as a state in which supreme power is held by the people and their elected representatives, this was not the case in south africa.
tgt_text: ka bomadimabe le fa re itse gore naga ya 'rephaboliki' e raya gore ke naga e e ikemetseng e e laolwang ke baagi ba yona le batho ba ba ba tlhophileng, mo nageng ya aforika borwa seno se ne se se jalo.

src_text: the constitution of the apartheid republic pledged allegiance to god, "who gathered our forebears together from many lands and gave them this as their own".
tgt_text: molaotheo wa rephaboliki ya puso ya tlhaolele o ne o ema nokeng modimo a le mongwe fela, "yo a kgobokantseng badimo ba bona go tswa kwa dinageng tse dintsi tse di farologaneng mme ba ba neela lefatshe leno go nna la bona ba le esi".

src_text: it was a constitution written by and for a racial minority, and it used faith to justify tyranny.
tgt_text: ono e ne e le molaotheo yo o kwadilweng ke morafe yo monnye mo merafeng ya ka kwano mme o kwaletswe bona, e bile o ne o dirisa tumelo jaaka segai sa go sireletsa bosula jo ba neng ba bo dira.

src_text: it outlined the administration of government, providing that only white people were eligible to vote and serve as public representatives.
tgt_text: molaotheo ono o ne o tlhomile tsamaiso ya puso e e direlang fela batho ba mmala o mosweu, e bile e ne e le bona fela ba ba letleletsweng go tsenela ditlhopho le go emela baagi mo pusong.

src_text: it contained no bill of rights.
tgt_text: mo go ona go ne go sena molaotlhomo wa ditshwanelo tsa batho.

src_text: the country’s majority was relegated to a footnote towards the end of its 121 provisions, in a section titled ‘administration of bantu affairs, etc.’.
tgt_text: bontsi jwa baagi ba ne ba sa tseelwe tlhogong ka dikgatlhegelo tsa bona di ne di beetswe kwa tlasetlase mo ditaelong tsa motheo di le 121 di felelang teng tsa molaotheo ono, mo kgaolong e e neng e reilwe setlhogo sa 'taolo ya merero ya bathobantsho, jalo le jalo'.

src_text: in a televised message, prime minister hf verwoerd said: "we seek the gradual development of each of our groups in a certain direction.
tgt_text: mo molaetseng wa thelebišene tonakgolo hf verwoerd o ne a re: "re tshwanetse go tlhabolola morafe yo mongwe le yo mongwe wa rona ka tsela e e rileng.

src_text: here the solution is openly sought by retaining the white man’s guiding hand.
tgt_text: mo ntlheng eno thuso e re e tlhokang ke go busiwa ke botlhale jwa motho yo mosweu.

src_text: "we are very happy to be a united people," he declared to the world.
tgt_text: "o ne a netefaletsa lefatshe gore, "re ipela go le maswe gore jaanong re setšhaba se le sengwe".

src_text: but the reality was that we were not a united people.

src_text: we were inhabitants of a country where one’s rights, prospects and life expectancy was determined by one’s race.
tgt_text: re ne re le baagi mo nageng eo ditshwanelo tsa batho ba bangwe, katlego ya bona le botshelo jwa bona bo neng bo laolwa ke ba morafe yo mongwe.

src_text: for two decades, the republic of south africa constitution act of 1961 was the legal impetus for the repression of nearly 90% of the south african population.
tgt_text: sebaka sa dingwagasome di le pedi, molao wa molaotheo wa rephaboliki ya aforika borwa wa 1961 o ne o dirisiwa jaaka komang kanna ya melao e e neng e gatelela 90% ya baagi ba aforika borwa.

src_text: this unhappy anniversary took place in the same month that we celebrated the 25th anniversary of the adoption by the constitutional assembly of our new democratic constitution, which became the birth certificate of a real united nation.
tgt_text: segopotso seno se se re gopotsang manyaapelo a a diragetseng se diragetse ka kgwedi e le nngwe le eo re neng re keteka segopotso sa ngwaga wa bo 25 wa fa e sale re tlhoma kokoano ya molaotheo ya molaotheo wa temokerasi ya rona e ntšhwa e e renang ka molaotheo, e leng ona sesupo sa nnete sa merafe e e kopaneng go nna setšhaba se le sengwe.

src_text: now we have one law for one nation.
tgt_text: gompieno re na le molao o le mongwe o o direlang setšhaba se le sengwe.

src_text: together, we have chosen for ourselves a system of government that gives true meaning to the concept of a republic.
tgt_text: rona rotlhe re itlhophetse ka borona thulaganyo ya puso e e supang bokao ba mmatota ba puso ya rephaboliki.

src_text: we have said that in our democratic republic, everyone is equal before the law and has the right to equal protection and benefit of the law.
tgt_text: mo temokerasing ya rona ya rephaboliki re boletse gore motho mang le mang molao o tla ba direla ka go lekana, wa ba sireletsa ka go lekana le go ba tswela molemo ka go lekana.

src_text: south africa today is a country where the administration of justice is vested in independent courts and a judiciary that is subject only to the constitution.
tgt_text: gompieno mo nageng ya aforika borwa tsamaiso ya molao e mo diatleng tsa 'kgotlatshekelo tse di ikemetseng mme ditheo tsa molao di ikarabela mo molaotheong.

src_text: we live in a country where everyone has the right to approach the courts for the fulfilment of their rights.
tgt_text: re tshelela mo nageng eo mo go yona motho mang le mang a nang le tshwanelo ya go ka leba kwa kgotlatshekelo go sireletsa ditshwanelo tsa gagwe.

src_text: we live in a country where communities can stake a legal claim on land they were forcefully moved from, and where individuals or families are protected against arbitrary eviction from their homes.
tgt_text: re tshela mo lefatsheng leo baagi ba ka tsenyang dikopo tsa semolao tsa go busediwa mafatshe a bokokokhukhu ba bona ba ba kileng ba ntshiwa mo mafatsheng a bona ka dikgoka, mo nageng eo batho le ba malapa a bona ba sireletsegileng go ka ntshiwa mo malapeng a bona ka mabaka a a tsewang ke phefo.

src_text: we live in a country where everyone is permitted to freely practise their culture and traditions.
tgt_text: re tshela mo lefatsheng leo motho mang le mang a letleletsweng go dira sengwe le sengwe se setso sa gagwe se mo laelang go se dira.

src_text: it is a country where anyone can freely protest in support of social, political and other causes anywhere.
tgt_text: eno ke naga e mo go yona motho mang le mang a letleletsweng go ka tsenela mogwanto o mongwe le o mongwe o a batlang go o tsenela a gwantela merero ya leago, dipolotiki le e mengwe le e mengwe e e mo gwetlhang ka fa teng.

src_text: our constitutional dispensation is premised on accountable government, where the executive is answerable to the people and where parliament is representative of the people.
tgt_text: molaotheo wa naga ya rona o kwadilwe ka tsela eo mo go ona puso e tshwanetseng go nna le maikarabelo, mo batlhankedibagolo ba puso ba ikarabelang mo batlhankeding ba palamente ba ba romilweng ke baagi go emela dikgatlhegelo tsa bona.

src_text: it is a country where the law applies equally to any citizen.
tgt_text: eno ke naga e mo go yona molao o dirisiwang ka go lekalekana mo baaging ba yona.

src_text: we now have a government of the people, for the people and by the people.
tgt_text: eno ke puso ya batho, e e direlang batho e bile e laolwa ke batho.

src_text: when the apartheid regime triumphantly paraded its racist constitution to the world 60 years ago, it had misplaced confidence that it would endure.
tgt_text: fa puso ya tlhaolele e ne e pepesa ka makoko molaotheo wa yona mo lefatsheng dingwaga di le 60 tse di fetileng, e ne e ithaa e re e fentse.

src_text: in an unanswered letter to verwoerd a month before the republic was declared, nelson mandela affirmed the liberation movement’s rejection of the forcibly imposed white republic.
tgt_text: mo lekwalong le verwoerd a sa itshwenyang go le araba le nelson mandela a mo kwaletseng lona kgwedi pele naga e tlhomiwa go nna ya rephaboliki, mo teng o ne a eme ka le le reng mekgatlho ya go lwela kgololesego ya re nama ya kgapeletsa e thuba pitsa mme ka jalo e kgatlhanong le dikgato tsa go gapelediwa go busiwa ke puso ya basweu.

src_text: he said that no constitution or form of government decided without the participation of the african people would enjoy moral validity.
tgt_text: o ne a re ga go molaotheo kgotsa mofuta ope wa puso o o tlhophilweng go dirisiwa ntle le go sekegela bana ba mmala wa sebilo tsebe o o tla retiwang gore o na le botho.

src_text: indeed no system that entrenches the systematic denial of people’s rights can be sustained.
tgt_text: ke boammaruri ga go thulaganyo epe e e ganetsang batho ba bangwe go nna le ditshwanelo e e kileng ya tshelela saruri.

src_text: though it would be over three decades before the demands of the liberation movement were met, we eventually won our freedom.
tgt_text: le fa go tsere dingwagasome di le tharo gore mekgatlho ya kgololesego e iponele kgololesego eno, kwa bokhutlhong re e bone.

src_text: in relegating the apartheid constitution to the dustbin of history, we committed ourselves to a new constitution and a new set of values.
tgt_text: fa re konopela molaotheo wa puso ya tlhaolele mo ditlakaleng tsa hisetori ya rona, re ne ra ikana ka molaotheo o montšhwa mmogo le metheo e mengwe e mentšhwa.

src_text: when i addressed the constitutional assembly 25 years ago, i said our constitution must become more than words on a page; it must become a reality in the lives of our people.
tgt_text: fa ke ne ke eme kokoano ya molaotheo ka lefoko dingwaga di le 25 tse di fetileng ke ne ka gatelela gore molaotheo wa rona o tshwanetse go se nne fela bokao jwa mafoko jo bo kwadilweng mo pampitshaneng; o tshwanetse go diragatsa seo re se bonang ka matlho a nama mo matshelong a batho ba naga ya rona.

src_text: unless we do so, this progressive and revolutionary document will be rendered irrelevant and meaningless.
tgt_text: fa re sa dire jalo, tokomane eno ya phetogo le tswelopele mo matshelong a rona e tla felelwa ke mosola le bokao mo bathong ba naga ya rona.

src_text: we have long decided what kind of society we want to be.
tgt_text: ga re a bolo go tsaya ditshwetso tsa gore re batla go ipona re le setšhaba se se ntseng jang.

src_text: it is a society rooted in human dignity, equality, freedom and nondiscrimination.
tgt_text: re batla go nna le setšhaba se se tlotlang seriti sa batho, se go nang le tekatekano mo go sona, se go nang le kgololesego e bile go sena tlhaolele.

src_text: for a quarter of a century we have worked to build such a society.
tgt_text: sebaka sa kotara ya ngwagakgolo re ntse re tsweletse go aga setšhaba se re buang ka sona seno.

src_text: we have made undeniable progress, but we still have many challenges and there is much work still to be done.
tgt_text: re dirile kgatelopele e go seng ope yo a ka e ganetsang, mme le fa go le jalo re santse re tobane le dikgwetlho tse di seng kana ka sepe mme e bile gape go santse go le go gontsi go re santseng re tlhoka go go dira.

src_text: as we mark the anniversary of the adoption of our democratic constitution, let us remember what a decisive break it was with the system underpinned by racism, exploitation, dispossession and oppression that had come before.
tgt_text: jaaka re keteka segopotso sa go tsenya tirisong molaotheo wa temokerasi ya rona, re tshwanetse go ikgopotsa gore re tswa kgakala go le kae moo puso ya nako eo e neng e itshametse ka tlhaolele ya bosemorafe, e ja batho ba bangwe ntshu, e tseela batho ba bangwe naga le dithoto le go ba gatelela mme ditiro tseo tsotlhe re ikinotse mo teng ga tsona.

src_text: let us also remember that it is up to us to make the vision contained in our constitution a reality.
tgt_text: re tshwanetse go gopola gape le gore ke rona ba re ka dirang gore ponelopele e e tlhagelelang mo molaotheong wa rona e tshele mme re e bone le ka matlho a rona a namana.

src_text: for it is only by ensuring that all south africans are able to freely and fully exercise their constitutional rights, that we will truly become a united people.
tgt_text: aforika borwa e kgaratlhela ponelopele ya molaotheo vukuzenzele unnamed dingwaga tse di fetileng di le 60 ka la bo 31 mo tsheganong 1961 puso ya tlhaolele ya aforika borwa e ne ya tsaya legato la gore e batla go nna naga ya rephaboliki, mme ka go dira jalo e ne ya supoga mo dinaleng tsa go laolelwa ke bogosi jwa britain.

src_text: the youth are our greatest asset vukuzenzele unnamed on june 16th 1976, the youth of soweto and other parts of the country rose up against the iniquity of bantu education.
tgt_text: bašwa ba botlhokwa thata mo go rona vukuzenzele unnamed ka seetebosigo 16 1976, bašwa ba kwa soweto le mafelo a mangwe ka fa nageng ba ne ba duba merusu go ipelaetsa kgatlhanong le thuto ya bathobantsho e e neng e sa tshwane le ya merafe e mengwe.

src_text: on that day and in the days that followed, many lost their lives.
tgt_text: ka letsatsi leo le mo matsatsing a a tla latelang, batho ba bantsi ba ne ba latlhegelwa ke matshelo a bona.

src_text: they were killed by a callous regime that had little regard for black lives and thought nothing of opening fire on unarmed, uniformed schoolchildren.
tgt_text: ba ne ba bolawa ke puso e e neng e sena sepe le botshelo jwa mothomotsho e bile go ne go se sepe se ba boneng e le phoso fa ba ne ba budulela dikolo mo mebeleng ya bana ba sekolo ba ba neng ba apere diaparo tsa sekolo e bile ba sa tlhomela.

src_text: these events hardened international opinion against the apartheid regime and gave further impetus to the liberation struggle.
tgt_text: ditiro tsa mothale ono di ne tsa gagamatsa maikutlo a dinaga tsa boditšhabatšhaba kgatlhanong le puso ya tlhaolele mme seno se ne sa naya maatla kgaratlhelo ya kgololesego.

src_text: young people have always been at the forefront of social protest, from the antiauthoritarian protests in latin america in the late 1950s, to the protests across africa in the late 1960s.
tgt_text: bašwa ka gale ke bona ba gogang kwa pele ditshupetso mo mererong ya loago, go tloga mo ditshupetsong tsa kwa latin america ka dingwaga tsa bo 1950, go tsenyeletsa le ditshupetso tse di neng di diragala go ralala le aforika kwa bokhutlhong jwa dingwaga tsa bo 1960. hisetori e rekotile ka botswapelo seabe seo bašwa ba 1976 ba nnileng le sona mo megwantong ya boditšhabatšhaba ya baithuti le dikgato tsa bona tsa go ema kgatlhanong le go tshwarwa makgwakgwa.

src_text: history faithfully records the contribution of the generation of 1976 to the international student movement and its stance against oppression and injustice.
tgt_text: tiragalo eno ya hisetori e e diragetseng mo dingwageng di le 45 tse di fetileng e santse e ketikiwa mo kontinenteng ya aforika le mo lefatsheng ka bophara.

src_text: this historic event 45 years ago continues to be commemorated across africa and the world.
tgt_text: ka jalo go a gagamatsa gore kitso ka ga ditiragalo tsa june 16 e a nyelela mo bašweng ba naga ya aforika borwa.

src_text: it is therefore disturbing that knowledge of june 16th is diminishing among young south africans.
tgt_text: seno se diragala bogolosegolo mo bašweng ba ba ipitsang gore ke generation z, bano ke bašwa ba ba belegweng magareng ga dingwaga tsa 1997 le 2015. dipatlisiso tsa aforika borwa tsa kitso le maitsholo mo mererong ya loago tsa ngwaga wa matlole wa 2019/2020 tse di phasaladitsweng ke lekgotla la dipatlisiso tsa saense le batho (hsrc) di ribolotse gore mo bašweng bano, 40% ya bona ga e itse sepe ka ditiragalo tseno e bile ga ba ise ba utlwele sepe fela ka ga tsona.

src_text: this is particularly so among the socalled generation z, or young people born between 1997 and 2015. the 2019/2020 south african social attitudes survey published by the human sciences research council found that close to 40% of generation z has not heard of the historical events of june 16th.
tgt_text: ba bangwe gape ba phesente e e tshwanang le yona eo ba utlwetse ka tsona mme ba na le kitso e e potlana thata ka ga tsona.

src_text: a similar percentage has heard about it but knows very little or nothing about it.
tgt_text: le fa go le jalo, dipatlisiso tseno gape di ribolotse gore bašwa bano ga ba kgatlhanong le go ithuta ka kitso e e botlhokwa ya hisetori e bile ba dumela gore e botlhokwa e bile e tla tswelela go nna botlhokwa.

src_text: nevertheless, the survey also found that young people of this generation are open to learning about key historical events and believe in their continued importance.
tgt_text: re le naga re tshwanetse go tsaya matsapa go netefatsa gore molaetsa wa ditiragalo tsa 1976 o fetisetswa kwa bathong ba bangwe ka botswapelo.

src_text: we need to do more as a country to ensure that the message of 1976 is transmitted faithfully.
tgt_text: ano ke maikarabelo a rona rotlhe re le puso, dikolo, ditheo tsa thuto e kgolwane, batsadi, malapa le masika, baopedi, badiragatsi le botlhe mo setšhabeng.

src_text: this is a collective responsibility of government, schools, tertiary institutions, parents, families, musicians, artists, and all of society.
tgt_text: bašwa ba ba belegweng morago ga go phutlhama ga puso ya tlhaolele ba iphitlhetse ba le ka fa gare ga puso ya temokerasi e e nang le molaotheo mo ditshwanelo tse di botlhokwa di tsewang tsia.

src_text: the generation that was born after apartheid ended inherited a country with a democratic constitution and where fundamental freedoms are protected.
tgt_text: ditšhono tse bašwa ba mmala wa sebilo ba gompieno ba nang le tsona di farologane thata le tsa ba mo nakong e efetileng e bile di tokafaditswe thata.

src_text: the opportunities young black people have today are both vastly different and greatly improved.
tgt_text: go tswelela go ruta bašwa ka ditiragalo tseno tsa june 16 ke segopotso mo bašweng ba gompieno gore bašwa ba mo malobeng ba ikentshitse setlhabelo go le kanakang gore bašwa ba gompieno ba utlwe monate wa kgololesego.

src_text: keeping the story of june 16th alive is a reminder to today’s generation of the great sacrifices made to secure their freedom.
tgt_text: letsatsi la go keteka mosola wa bašwa ke segopotso sa gore bašwa ba na le maatla a le mantsi bokanakang le gore ba mo lebelong le le kanakang fa go tla mo go direng gore bokamoso jwa bona bo tokafale.

src_text: youth day is a reminder of the immense power and agency that young people have to create a better future for themselves.
tgt_text: dikgwetlho tse bašwa ba tobaneng le tsona mo nageng ya aforika borwa di thiba letsatsi.

src_text: the struggles of young people in south africa today are many.
tgt_text: bašwa ga ba bolo go gapa kwa pele dikgato tsa go lwela ditshwanelo, go sa kgathalesege gore di mabapi le go lwela thuto ya mahala kgotsa go ema kgatlhanong le maitshwaro a a bodileng a tirisodikgoka e e totileng batho ba bong jo bo rileng (gbv).

src_text: young people have remained at the forefront of activism, whether in pursuit of free education or against social ills like genderbased violence.
tgt_text: gompieno ntwa e kgolo eo bašwa ba tobaneng le yona e kgatlhanong le botlhokatiro, jo ga jaanong bo tswileng mo taolong fa e sale leroborobo leno la covid19 le runya ka fa nageng.

src_text: today the greatest struggle young people wage is against unemployment, which has worsened under the covid19 pandemic.
tgt_text: tiro e e kwa setlhoeng mo pusong eno ke go tlholela bašwa ditšhono tse dintsi tsa ditiro le go dira gore bašwa bano ba fitlhelele ditšhono tseo.

src_text: creating more opportunities for young people, and access to these opportunities, is government’s foremost priority.
tgt_text: sengwe le sengwe se re se dirang re le puso se na le seabe mo go tokafatseng matshelo a bašwa.
